What did I say?
I said no phones.
I said anyone caught with a phone will be in serious trouble.
translation.es: Dije que a quien se le encontraraun teléfono, la pagaría.

translation.en: Not only does she have a phone, she has been spying on us!
translation.es: Ella no solo tiene un teléfono,¡sino que estuvo espiándonos!

translation.en: Using it to send information about where we are.
translation.es: Lo usó para enviar informaciónde nuestra ubicación.

translation.en: No! No.
No. No.
-Linda... -No.
-Linda... -Please. No.
Linda!
-Quiet! -Linda!
Everyone go pack your things and get ready.
We are leaving now!
Are you all deaf? Move!
Move!
Why did you have to kill her?
She was sending information to someone. Who was she?
translation.es: Le enviaba información a alguien.¿Quién era?

translation.en: What if she is from the police?
-I don't know. -Wrong answer. It's your job to know.
translation.es: - No sé.- Es tu trabajo saberlo.

translation.en: -You're supposed to investigate. -I did all my checks.
translation.es: - Se supone que debes investigar.- Lo hice.

translation.en: Well, you didn't do a good job.
I swear if this doesn't turn out well, you'll be in big trouble.
translation.es: Te juro que si esto sale mal,tendrás muchos problemas.

translation.en: -Do you know where her family lives? -Of course. I know.
translation.es: - ¿Sabes dónde vive su familia?- Claro que sí.

translation.en: We need to send them a message. Let them know who they are playing with.
translation.es: Debemos enviarles un mensaje.Que sepan con quiénes se meten.

translation.en: -Heli. -Yes, boss.
Please change your clothes.
Please.
-Take those girls. -Okay, boss.
translation.es: - Trae a esas chicas.- Sí, jefe.

translation.en: Hey madam, stand up, let's go. Up!
-Stand up! Let's go! -I said stand up and go!
Move. I said move!
Avoid their faces in case we still need them.
translation.es: Evita las caras.Quizá aún las necesitemos.

translation.en: What do you know about the phone?
This one's a rural girl. Take her away.
She's an idiot. She doesn't know anything.
translation.es: Es una idiota. No sabe nada.

translation.en: This one...
I'm not too sure about this one.
translation.es: No estoy muy segura de ella.

translation.en: What do you know about the phone?
I don't know anything.
-What do you know about the phone? -Nothing.
-What do you know about the phone? -Nothing.
You don't know anything?
-You don't know anything? -I don't know--
Do you think I am joking?
What do you know about the phone?
Do you think I'm a rookie?
Are you crazy? What do you know about the phone?
-You want to ruin my business, right? -No.
You want to ruin my business, right?
You don't want to talk?
You don't want to talk, right?
What happened?
Looks like they got away before we got here.
They must have been tipped off. They left in a hurry.
translation.es: Les habrán avisado. Se fueron apurados.

translation.en: Where would they go now?
Go to the poolside at the back of the house.
translation.es: Vaya a la piscina en la parte de atrás.

translation.en: There's a body lying there. Check if it's not your reporter.
translation.es: Hay un cuerpo. Vea si no es su periodista.

translation.en: Mr. Victor.
An important person.
Mr. Victor.
-How are you? -I'm good. How are things with you?
-How are you? -I'm well.
-Hope the business is thriving? -The usual, we keep pushing.
translation.es: - Espero que el negocio marche.- Como siempre, nos esforzamos.

translation.en: Miss?
Where are you going?
-I want to pee. -I need to have a shit.
translation.es: - Quiero hacer pis.- Necesito ir a cagar.

translation.en: You're full of shit.
We are about to cross the border and you guys need to go shit!
translation.es: ¡Estamos a punto de cruzar la frontera,y necesitan cagar!

translation.en: Alright, move. Move fast!
Fast, no time!
Let go of her hand! Keep going.
This way!
Move!
Where are your papers?
What are you transporting? I want to know what you're taking across the border.
translation.es: ¿Qué transporta? Quiero saberqué lleva al otro lado de la frontera.

translation.en: I said, open your trunk. I want to see if you're carrying anything illegal.
translation.es: Dije que abra el maletero.Déjeme ver si no lleva nada ilegal.

translation.en: "You're not carrying much." That's what they always say.
I told you to leave.
I'm a journalist. As a matter of fact, this is a matter of life and death.
translation.es: Soy periodista. Es una cuestión de vida o muerte.

translation.en: It is important. My staff is there. I need to be there.
translation.es: Es importante. Mi empleada está ahí.

translation.en: Please understand my point.
You understand me now. I said shut up, get in the car and leave.
translation.es: Entienda usted.Cállese, suba a su auto y váyase.

translation.en: Help! Help me!
-Help me! -Help us!
Help! Help us! Help!
Help! Someone help! Someone!
Where the hell did she run off to?
What's wrong with her? What kind of nonsense is that?
Close the door.
What's going on here?
See. I'm trying to-- See...
I am a journalist. There's an emergency I need to attend to.
Somebody's life is at stake.
This place is a military zone. Go back!
-I understand that. -I said go back.
Will you please look--
-Go back! -Just calm down now.
Try to listen to me and understand what I'm trying to say.
translation.es: Intente escuchar y entender lo que digo.

translation.en: What...
You don't... You're not...
What the...
